campaign.story:
THE GROWLIGHT, REINVENTED    
Growing tired of a lifeless interior? Have you ever considered growing a lemon tree indoors? Maybe strawberries on the wall? A pineapple? I know what you’re thinking, there is NO WAY I can grow a pineapple in my house! Actually, it is quite easy with the support of the Aspect.
The Aspect is the first LED grow light developed specifically for interior design, allowing you to grow whatever plant you want wherever you want while aesthetically enhancing any space.
ENERGY EFFICIENT – Save hundreds on electricity and maintenance over other technologies.
CUSTOMIZE - With over 17 different cord choices and the addition of a lampshade, your plants will be growing in style.
FULL GROW SPECTRUM – Maximize plant growth and improve plant quality with our full spectrum LED light that is efficiently absorbed by plants.
BUILT TO LAST - Never replace our bulb! We assemble the Aspect right here in Bethlehem, PA to insure the highest quality! With the help of our US based LED manufacturer, we can achieve a lifespan of over 90,000 hours!
SMALL OR LARGE - Support most small plants with our 20 watt unit, or grow trees with our 40 watt units. We even offer a commercial high yield package of 160 watts.
SUPPORT YOUR HEALTH - Houseplants extract up to 87% of pollutants from indoor air, including volatile organic compounds, formaldehyde, pesticides and more.
WARRANTY - We pride ourselves on our dedication to each customer, because to us, customer satisfaction is everything. We offer a 3-year warranty, with a 90-day Money Back Guarantee!
CHRISTMAS DELIVERY Great gift idea for anyone. We guarantee to deliver the EARLY BIRD special packages before Christmas.
Limited light? Whether you are growing near a window in a dark corner of your room, the Aspect is here to help. With the right light, you can easily grow any plant inside. It is time to get creative with your décor!
2 clicks is all it takes to share our campaign and make a huge difference
Depending on what you want to grow, we have an Aspect for it! We outlined applications and coverage below to help you pick the right Aspect for your home.
The SMALL 20 watt Aspect is great for partial sun plants such as houseplants plants, herb, spices, succulents, flowers, and some bonsais. It is also great for those larger plants that just need an extra boost of light to thrive indoors.
The LARGE 40 watt Aspect can support larger plants that demand full sun, such as tomatoes, cannabis, peppers and more. It is great for citrus trees and fruiting plants that grow to a large size and need more intense light coverage.
An interchangeable lamp shade hook is included in your Aspect Kit which allows you to hang most lampshades to match the decor of any room (lamp shade not included).
Just hook it, hang it, and plug it in! The Aspect is incredibly easy to set up. With 3 easy steps you will be on your way to enhancing your home with beautiful green plants.
 Don't want to hang the Aspect from the ceiling? Don't worry, there are numerous alternatives such as a Shepards hook
Plants convert certain wavelengths of light into energy using photosynthesis. With the wrong light, plants will elongate or die. Too much blue light and your plants will never grow, too much red and they will never develop strong roots. By using LED technology, we are able to produce the exact wavelengths in the right balance of blue and red that supports beautiful, healthy plants.
We offer two spectrums for both residential and commercial growers.
Décor White (20w & 40w Aspect Kits)
Brilliant white for Décor Lighting
3000K Color Temperature
Represents Colors Vibrantly (High CRI Value), no blue or red tint
Supports Plant Growth
High Yield Amber (Deluxe 420 Package & upon request)
Amber Color
Designed for Large and Commercial Grows
1700K Color Temperature
Supports Plant Growth
We reached our goal of $9,500 so if our backers get us to the $20,000 mark we will make 10 additional cord colors available.  These are vintage fabric multicolor cords that can be chosen for both white and black units. 
Canada: The Aspect is designed to work worldwide, with operating voltages between 90 VAC to 264 VAC, 50/60 Hz. You will get a timer. Shipping rates vary from $30 for a single unit to $55 for the 420 deluxe package.
World Wide: The Aspect is designed to work worldwide, with operating voltages between 90 VAC to 264 VAC, 50/60 Hz. Unfortunately, we are not able to include timers with the international shipments. You will have to locally source an analog outlet timer.
International Shipping: International shipping is handled with either UPS Express, Fedex Express, DHL Express or Priority Mail Express World Wide. We will not ship any other method. All international shipments include tracking numbers and insurance for the cost of the entire purchase. Rates vary from $50 for a single unit to $85 for the 420 deluxe package.
CUSTOMS:  Because of strict agriculture custom policies we will not be able to ship the 'Basil Seeds' with the kit to ALL international backers.  We appoligize for any inconviences.
Pictured from left to right is Chris, Mike, and Paul; we are Soltech Solutions. Our team is compiled of Penn State University and Temple University graduates with backgrounds in Environmental Science, Energy Engineering, and Political Science.    
We initially created Soltech Solutions 2 years ago to design and manufacture traditional, high powered, red and blue growlights. After some extensive research in groundbreaking LED technology and plant growth we realized there were no growlights that could efficiently grow your plants while simultaneously creating a welcoming indoor atmosphere. We set out to bring a solution to this problem and developed the first décor pendant style growlight.
In the early stages of development we ran through heaps of prototypes finally landing on a design that could work. The first model of the Aspect hit the market January of 2016 and we’ve had nothing but positive feedback.
Because of our manufacturing space (the basement of a local business incubator) and the long manufacturing process, we knew we had to come up with a better design. We took all of your feedback into consideration and developed the new Aspect model. It’s sleeker, more efficient, and includes custom options never before offered. With a colorful choice of cords and the addition of lampshades, your home décor will never look the same.
Our mission is for everyone to be able to use our product, weather you have a green thumb or are a Grass-assassin! We want to make it easy for people to bring nature indoors and with the Aspect, you can.
Check us out on:
http://www.thevalleyledger.com/?p=22075
http://areatech51.com/aspect-first-grow-light-developed-interior-design-launches-kickstarter/
http://kickingitforward.org

campaign.story:
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO GET THIS THING ANIMATED!
The film has already been shot and the actors have gone home. We need your help to get the footage animated by redrawing (rotoscoping) every single frame by hand. 
WHAT WILL THE ANIMATION LOOK LIKE?
This poster is in the style of the animation.
Sticky Fingers Poster. This is also what the animation will look like.
Here's an earlier project I did in a similar technique of shooting real actors and then animating over them. STICKY FINGERS will be similar to this in style, but will be a narrative film with actors, and textures similar to the poster. If you like this style of animation, you'll love this short film.
JOKER GREETING CARD!!
I'm the Co-Founder of Joker Greeting Cards and we made a special edition HALLOWEEN CARD for this campaign.
When you give your friend/enemy this card and they press the PLAY button, the card will play this ANNOYING scream sound over and over again for 3+ hours straight... the screaming WILL NOT STOP until they destroy it. And when they tear it open SKULL CONFETTI will spill all over them!  Order yours now for an OCTOBER 2016 release.
Joker Halloween Card.
WE WANT YOU TO BE SEEN AND HEARD IN THIS FILM!
We have the power to draw you into the film.  You don't have to be an actor, or even a professional voice artist.
If you've ever wanted to live out a personal dream, or goal, or have something fun to share with your family and friends! I'd love for you to be a part of this with us!
THE STORY!
This is a 4 min. horror short about a man controlled remotely by a bio-electronic mask to stalk a woman as she jogs home to her husband and young children. Who is this man? Who is controlling him behind this mask? And what do they want with this woman?
That's as far as I wanna go into detail, but trust me everything will be revealed in the short!
WHY WE NEED YOU!
This is a different kind of animated film.
The short has already been shot and edited and now we need your help to do the animation. -- This will be created by the classic technique of hand drawn rotoscope animation. Basically, the live action footage will now be re-drawn as animation.
This is NOT a fancy photoshop filter, It will be hand drawn by people not robots.
DANNY ELFMAN!!
We have 2 posters and 4 CD Soundtracks Signed by Danny Elfman
SIGNED Nightmare Revisited CD
Danny Elfman Rewards - Signed SPIDERMAN - SLEEPY HOLLOW - BETTLEJUICE CD SOUNDTRACKS
SIGNED 24'' tall and 16'' wide Poster from Danny Elfman's Music from the Films of Tim Burton Oct 30 - Nov 2 2014 shows at LA Live and Nokia Theater
SIGNED Nightmare Revisited Poster by Danny Elfman. Super Rare!
CLIVE BARKER!
Clive barker has generously donated 3 SIGNED prints. 
Signed Clive Barker Painting #1
Signed Clive Barker Painting #2
Signed Clive Barker Painting #3
ORIGINAL ARTWORK FROM THE FILM
If you want something that no one else has, you can get a signed 8x10 printed frame from the film. Each one of these will be unique so yours will be the only one like it in the world!
Every Hand Crafted Frame is a Work of Art
 WHO'S MAKING THIS???
I'm Nick Peterson, the writer-director. If you're curious about me you can go deep and check out my website here... www.npfilm.com Or you can get a good sense of who I am by watching this supercut of my films HERE!
I have teamed up with Mali Elfman and Michael May of FUN SIZE horror to create this very cool and very unique short film. And since the FUN SIZE guys are involved you know that this short will not sit on a digital shelf collecting digital dust it'll be seen by millions of people around the world.
Check out all the awesome stuff FUNSIZE has to offer here!
http://www.funsizehorror.com

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone, 
It's a bummer, but we didn't make this one. And while I'm sad things aren't going forward with Sticky Fingers at this time, I'm happy with the experience I had making some new friends and re-connecting with old ones. 
All of you please keep in touch, and thanks again for your support!!

Hey everyone,
A lot of you asked me to remind you when the campaign is about to expire, and with only a few days left we're getting to the end.
I know it seems really hard to make this happen, but it's not if we all push forward. 
As a reminder Kickstarter only rewards with 100% funding and I want to get all these great DANNY ELFAMN,  CLIVE BARKER and JOKER CARDS rewards out to you guys, so please share this and lets see if we can build this to the kickstarter comeback of the year!

Hey Everyone!
iHorror just did an awesome article about the project and our numbers are going up fast with new backers and new money! Yay!
We've got lots of time left, but as a reminder this is crowd funded project if we don't make our goal I can't get these sweet rewards to you, so spread the word and build this crowd with this link: http://kck.st/2320W4z

Hey Everyone, 
A lot of people are asking if it's possible to get multiple rewards. It's super easy to do, just add to your current reward the $$ amount of the other rewards you want and just message me about it and I'll make a note so you can get both rewards.
We've been doing a press outreach the past few weeks, in ICYM them here are some links!

Hey Everyone!
Super excited about this building campaign. Every time I do these I have to remind myself that it's a marathon not a sprint. Thanks for being the early supporters!
We've got some cool announcements coming down over the next few weeks and in the meantime, here are some cool articles about our campaign!

Hey Everyone!
Thanks again for being the earliest backers and getting this thing started on an awesome pace. We're only 2 days in with $2K and that's pretty awesome!
Just a quick update, I updated the Clive Barker paintings to show the actual ones with the signatures, and I also added the Signed Danny Elfman poster to the rewards.

campaign.story:
It started as an obsession to find a comfortable pair of jeans that you could put on in the morning and wear cycling, hiking or climbing, and still look stylish for a meeting or night out. This was the foundation for Boulder Denim. Knowing that there are many pants with many features we decided to design a pant that included the most useful of those features, making them the most functional and stylish jeans on the market.
Our sizing guarantee to YOU:
In the year we spent developing Boulder Denim we realized a few important things about fit and sizing.
For women, we discovered that we could completely simplify the fitting process when we finally settled on the blend that makes up our patented ultra-stretch denim. After testing our woman’s cut on women that are both slim and curvy, we were able to design a single cut that fits virtually all body types.
Because men don’t typically wear skin tight clothing it was important to design a cut that sits naturally on a man’s lower body, while not being overly tight. This discovery lead to the creation of our two fits, SLIM and ATHLETIC.
We are so confident with our sizing that if your jeans don’t fit, all you do is send them back to us and we will send you another pair on us.
*Customers outside of North America will be charged an additional $20 for international shipping.
 FOR MEN:
To determine your fit, there are two key measurements.
First, measure the smallest part of your waist at your natural waistline. Second, measure your thigh 2 inches below your crotch Then cross reference, your waist and thigh measurement with the sizing chart to determine your fit. Men looking for a skinny fit can size down. The denim will stretch to your body.
FOR WOMEN:
You only need to measure the smallest part of your waist at your natural waistline. Our jeans are so incredibly stretchy to ensure an absolutely skin tight fit we recommend sizing down.
Made with the climber in mind and created to truly combine fashion and adventure for a slimmer fit you can wear anytime.
Medium rise that sits just above the hip, slim through the thigh, knee and calf with a slight taper
Offers a perfectly tailored fit that works for men with slim to medium legs.
Fits well for slim or medium builds as the taper increases proportionally with waist size.
BEST FOR: Men with slim to medium legs that want a tailored look.
For the gym rat, crossfitter or bodybuilder. This fit is muscular-glute approved and designed for men that spend a lot time in the gym.
Medium rise that sits just above the hip, more room through the thigh, knee and calf with a slight taper.
Offers more thigh and calf room for men with muscular legs.
BEST FOR: Men with big legs that have trouble finding pants that can accommodate their thighs. These are for the crossfitter, bodybuilder or football player that never skips leg day. They also look great on men with thicker legs or larger builds that are looking for a roomier fit.
Designed to combine our 360-degree stretch and a perfect cut that embraces the natural movement of a woman’s body. The stretch is perfect for women of all shapes.
Medium/Higher rise, that is meant to move with you as your body bends.
The ultra-stretch denim allows you to have a higher-waist that doesn’t restrict movement or dig in when you bend over.
BEST FOR: Women that are slim to very curvy. The denim is so unbelievably stretchy that it will hug even the most curvaceous women.
So rest assured and order with confidence that not only will these pants fit you perfectly and feel amazing, your butt will look phenomenal!
The Boulder Denim brand was inspired by necessity and created by adventurists. We know what it’s like having to balance our thirst for thrill and everyday responsibilities. Which is why created our denim to cater to whatever it is your day has in store for you. Aside from selling comfortable pants, we wanted to be the true advocates for adventure and we’ll do this by giving back to you, our amazing community. 
#1 | Every year a portion of our earnings will go towards our “What’s your adventure?” campaign. You tell us what your idea of an epic getaway would be and the person with the best trip will be decided upon by the Boulder Denim community. The prize being the trip you dreamt and 2016’s trip that will be accompanied by world record highliner, Spencer Seabrooke and the boulder denim team. 
#2 | The “Everyday Athlete Sponsorship Program” (EASP). We realized that like ourselves, we all lead busy lives, yet we still find time to train hard. Our skill is built on our dedication. We want to give back to these athletes in recognition of their hard work and inspiration they bring to others. This means support and of course free Boulder Denim gear.
A huge thank you to these companies for allowing us to shoot in their establishments. 
The Hive
Portland Craft 
Milano Coffee 
Revolver Coffee
The General Public 
And thank you to Rich Emmerson @ travelshootshare.com  and Tanner Dunn @ thefrvr.com for their incredible photography work.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1. We already have people testing out our pre-production samples around the globe. We're ready to hit "go" on production immediately after we receive our funds from Kickstarter. This is usually two weeks after our campaign ends successfully.

2. Our stain repellent and hydrophobic technology can be done a number of ways. Choosing the type of technology will depend on how many pairs of jeans we sell. Some methods are quicker than others and it could potentially delay the estimated delivery time by up to 30 days. 

3. Other delays and unforeseen obstacles may occur along the way but this is highly unlikely as we're equipped to produce a very large quantity of jeans.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey everyone!
First off, we would like to thank all our original backers for your support. We've come a long way from our Kickstarter days and the Boulder Denim brand is growing quickly.

updates.update_userinfo: Last Chance for Direct-to-Consumer Pricing and Tour Update
updates.update_content:
Hey guys,
It's been a while since we last updated you so here's the latest:
Direct to Consumer Pricing: Since we launched back in November 2015 we've had a direct-to-consumer pricing model. We were able to offer you lower pricing since we didn't have any distributors and weren't in retailers yet. With our big tour coming up and tons of stores requesting wholesale pricing, our retail pricing will be changing from $129 USD to $148 USD (or $174 CAD to $198 CAD). The good news is you have until April 1st, 2017 to snag a pair or two at the discounted direct-to-consumer pricing. and grab a pair now!

updates.update_userinfo: We're just getting started! Big things happening in 2017.
updates.update_content: It's been a while since our last update and we've got some exciting updates for you.
Happy Holidays from our unofficial mascot Koda and the Boulder Denim team.

Hey Backers!
We're happy to announce that all orders have been shipped and that a lot of you have already received your jeans. We've already heard some great feedback from our backers on Twitter and Instagram. Keep your posts coming, we love hearing your praise!
US/International Orders: Many of you have already received your jeans. If you're looking for your tracking information, you should be able to see it now when you go to  and enter your email address.

Hey Backers!
We have a quick update for you today. 
ALL US and International orders were shipped out over the past two days. You'll receive them either Fedex Home Delivery or USPS Priority Mail. We're having an issue with tracking numbers. You should be able to login to BackerKit.com and view your tracking information but it's not working like it's suppose to. We're working hard with BackerKit today to solve this issue so you'll be able to track your packages.

Hey backers!
We know we said that the jeans should be shipping out to you now but as you know, we keep stumbling across delays. The freight from our manufacturing facility in Quebec to our fulfilment centres in Vancouver and Chicago has taken longer than expected. For some reason (most likely distance related), our Chicago fulfilment centre received the pallets first. The freight to our Vancouver warehouse is still in transit and we were told by the freight company today that it will arrive at our Vancouver fulfilment centre on November 7th or 8th.

Hi Backers!
Last week we updated you with a timeline and shipping address change requests. This week we would like to update you again on where we're at with shipping.
Orders Without Jeans:
All t-shirts, chalk buckets, hats, and tanks have shipped if there was no jean order attached with them. Some of you may have already received your gear.

updates.update_userinfo: Last call for address and sizing changes
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
We're so excited to announce that two out of our three styles have finished production with the third being wrapped up sometime next week. This means that you all have one week to email us with any size or address changes. If you won't be home to accept the package, we highly recommend shipping it to a friend or family member instead.
You have until next Friday, October 21st at 8:00am PST to send us any changes.

campaign.story:
Update#4 What will make Might Brawlers fresh and fun to play
Update #3 Brawler Packs on Dribbble
Update #2 Offline and Single Player Experience
Update #1 Why are we looking at Ouya?
Mighty Brawlers is nearly feature complete! All the major parts are in place for the basic gameplay. Multiplayer, Brawlers, weapons, and multiple maps are ready to go. Over the next rounds of development we will be working on extending our custom game editors for more variety and awesomeness. Let's begin with some talk on the game and our plans.
We say retro multiplayer platform mayhem, and we mean every word of it. Mighty Brawlers is built on solid old school platforming with updated twists.
We have added tools to ensure the mayhem of brawling will be in tune with how a retro platformer would play. Intuitive strafing, and simple angular aiming took us a bit of time to refine, but they were worth the effort. Ultimately, moonwalking as the Mad Hatter while pwning with a Velociraptor gun is quite amusing. 
We have added teleport stations to allow for jumping between and around maps. Teleporting is handled with a timer to free you from the need to press a trigger, or heaven forbid to stop firing to tap another button.  It can be an escape or means to jump to another part of the map.
A few testers have described it as a retro Smash Brothers, meets Super Mario Bros., in a Halo death match. 
Each Brawler has been pixel-crafted with loving care. We have the ambitious goal of 200 unique Brawlers, each with a unique weapon. Then after launch, we want to continue with at least 1 new Brawler pack per week. 
There are 75 Brawlers in the current roster. All unique, but a few favorites that might need licensing ;). We couldn't resist putting a few well-known characters in for pre-release testing. Of course they will need to be removed if we can't secure a license. 
59 of 200 Brawlers
What is a Brawler Pack?
A Brawler Pack is a group of usually 3 - 5 themed Brawlers with an accompanying weapon. This an example of the Military Brawler Pack. 
General/.44; Soldier/MP5; Sniper/.50cal; Pilot/9mm; Battle Rattle/RPG
Some packs will have more, while some will have fewer. There will be packs with 7 Brawlers, like Dante's Inferno Brawler Pack. While a pack with only 1 Brawler will be quite unique. (Just wait until you see Uncle Sam).
Our world is ginormous! We are planning on 3 maps on our launch date. A map will be a section of the world dedicated to one type of style, like neighborhoods. There will be missions and NPC's specific to each map. We are planning to release a new map each month. 
If you can image 2 sugar cubes (a Brawler) stacked inside something the size of 2 football fields, this is getting close to our total area. Mighty Brawlers' world will be constantly evolving and growing. Each map will bring its own challenges and benefits. 
Where will the money go? Content, Expansion, Platforms & Servers.
Content
Both our roster and world are huge. We will use the funding to dedicate more of our time and talents to fleshing out both of these. 
Generally, a Brawler goes from idea to animation in around 2 hours. After they are running around, we have to create their weapons, and projectiles; then build both of them out for playability. 
Next, we have tile sets and our maps. The tile sets that are already or nearly completed are dirt, ghetto, warehouse, and pipe. We will then plan each enormous map, create NPC's & backgrounds. Then actually build it out. 
We have thousands of hours of content creation ahead of us.
Expansion
Our game is already playable. We want it to launch with an amazing set of features. We need time and some support to extend our list. These are the most important items.
Character Editor - Extend parameters to allow for flight/hover, and wall climbing.
Weapon Editor - Extend to account for 2nd weapon.
Bullet Editor - Extend to account for flight patterns, attribute manipulation, spawning, waves, and multi-origin points.
World Editor - Extend teleports, switches, and rewrite "water/lava".
Redeem System - Create a system where users will be able to input codes to unlock packs and worlds. 

Platforms
When we reach our funding goal of $25k, we will be launching Mighty Brawlers on 2 gaming platforms.
iOS
Android
Servers
Our servers are running on Node.js, and tweaked for performance. These are ready to really turn some sweet multiplayer action for everyone. As the game grows and expands to have more and more players, we want to be prepared to scale quickly and effectively. Then be ready to handle the costs of supporting multiple servers running more than 1000 players per map. 
Double Our Fun(ds)! - $50,000
We're participating in OUYA's #FreeTheGames Fund, created by OUYA to support developers making new and creative console games. OUYA will match your pledge dollar-for-dollar if we raise a minimum of $50,000, so help us get there and make a great game for everyone! To be eligible for this match, we commit that this game will be an OUYA exclusive for six months—no matter what. To learn more about OUYA, go to www.ouya.tv
We are ready and prepared to release on Android and iOS if our funding goal of $25k is met! However, if we can reach the stretch goal of $50k we can release our game on Ouya first, and add more Brawlers, more maps, and more features!
Stretch Goal Additions:
Ouya Release!
200 More Brawlers at launch
3 More Maps
New Features: personal Brawler upgrades, revenge system, team system, power-ups, and BOSS LEVELS! (Join up to conquer the Kraken!)

Check them out. They are quite useful.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are challenges to overcome before launch of Mighty Brawlers. 

1. The exorbitant amount of Brawlers. We have 75 Brawlers ready, we want 125 more before launch. This just takes time. 

2. The vast world that is NOT auto-generated. We have to touch every single one of 864,000,000 tiles to fill our world. We don't plan on having all this done at launch, but we want to get a solid running start. Again, this just takes dedicated time to plan, build and test. 

3. We need to focus more on building Mighty Brawlers, than playing it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Lots of questions about offline and single player. This should wrap it all up.

campaign.story:
VIDEO UPDATE #2
VIDEO UPDATE
Here's a link to our Steam Greenlight page, and Video Game trailer.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=143883857
STARRING - AMY SMART & DOUG JONES 
Starring Amy Smart as "The Mom"
Starring Doug Jones as "The Demon"
DEVELOPMENT ART WORK
Here is some early art work my buddy Paul Linsley drew up for us to get the ball rolling and ideas flowing regarding textures, muscles, mass and features of the demon. Steve Wang will take these drawings, and other references and make it into something cohesive and amazing. 
Development Artwork of "The Demon" to be played by Doug Jones
Concept Art
THE VISITANT 
GENRE: HORROR
SYNOPSIS : A MOTHER PROTECTS HER CHILDREN FROM A DEMONIC INTRUDER   
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Unlike a feature film which has a market to make money once it's been made, there is no short film sales market. And because there is no financial gain for an investor, it's hard to get the money needed to make unique projects like this.
Kickstarter lets us give you unique rewards you cannot get anywhere else and in exchange you give us the artistic freedom to create new and uniquely awesome content just for you. 
After our first successful Kickstarter collaboration on the short film DRAINED, we have re-teamed again to create both a film and a video game. Influenced by classic horror films like THE SHINING, but updated for today’s audiences who love films like INSIDIOUS and PARANORMAL ACTIVITY we want to give you an awesome experience.
Why a film and a game? We know your hard earned money is valuable, and you want a lot of stuff for it. So this time around we're going beyond the short and we're including a video game that expands the story told in the short film.
We agree that most video games based on films generally suck. They suck because there's no story, no cool characters and no ambiance to get pulled into . . . they're lame cause nobody cares while making them. Jon and I are avid gamers who love games like Bio-Shock (HOLY CRAP ISN'T 'INFINITE' AMAZING), Skyrim and Zelda... (games that tell a story) and we want to make something awesome. While the film tells the story of a mother who protects her children from a demon in her house the game tells the origin story of the demon and is a prequel to the short film.  As a gamer it will take you on a journey of moral choices and lead you to emotions that you may or may not want to visit.
What if we get more money than we're asking for?  Every indie film and video game is written with a minimum budget in mind to make something great, but we all have awesome ideas in our back pocket that we'd love to do if we get more money.  
If we go beyond our goal, we can expand both projects and give you things that weren't possible before. Basically, the more money we get, the more cool visual stuff we can put onto the screen. 
THE FILM
For the past 6 years each October Jon has hosted a weekly series of horror film screenings for a small group of friends... since then we've seen A LOT of horror films and we're really excited to make a film that movie lovers AND fans of the genre will love. We've put together an amazing roster of talent to make it happen.
STARRING - DOUG JONES  as THE DEMON. Doug is a true master of bringing character and personality to unique creatures. We’re really excited to work with Doug to make a new original creature.
Doug Jones as... All of these guys.
STARRING - AMY SMART as THE MOM. We're very excited to announce that Amy has joined us in the making of this film! She'll keep the fear and the high emotion of a mom scared to death to face the unknown, but does it to save her daughter. 
CREATURE DESIGNER - STEVE WANG We wanted to make sure Doug looks 100% legit as our demon, so we called up Steve. As a veteran special makeup effects artist and creature designer from films like Hellboy I&II, X-Men: Last Stand, The Predator, and Underworld. Steve has worked with fellow veterans before him including Stan Winston, Rick Baker and Dick Smith. Steve will make sure that Doug looks creepy, scary, and above all realistic.
Steve Wang with The Predator
COMPOSER - CHRIS BACON has scored films like the Jake Gyllenhaal film SOURCE CODE and gave us the haunting score on DRAINED. Most recently he's been writing like crazy for the new Bates Motel series on A&E. 
Chris Bacon, composer for the new Bates Motel series on A&E.
THE VIDEO GAME - Every story has to start somewhere. 
The game tells the origin story of the demon as an RPG set in the world of the 1930's dust bowl. The story is about a father who makes a deal with a demon to accomplish a series of tasks to save his dying family. Here are some early beta released stills from the game so nothing is final. We're excited to take you from a poor dust bowl farm, into the bowels of the demon's lair and beyond.
Character Description
Inside Spencer's humble home. Circa 1930's dustbowl.

Instead of discovering the water he needs to save his family, Spencer finds a demon willing to offer him oceans of water in exchange for one night of service.
Spencer looking for water.
The demon's humble lair
Will you choose to do the demon's work to save your dying family, or will you go back to your family empty handed and pray for rain?
REWARDS
We're trying to give you guys unique rewards that you can only get from us.  Check out on the right side of the page what we have to offer. Below is some additional info we can't squeeze into the column on the right.
CUSTOM PORTRAIT DRAWING BY NAPOLEON DYNAMITE
Did you know that Jon did all of the drawings in Napoleon Himself? It's been a long time since he drew Trisha and now he's ready to spend a couple of hours working on your upper lip.
Slaving away at the drawing board
SIGNED NAPOLEON DYNAMITE & BLADES OF GLORY DVDs by JON HEDER
Signed by ND himself
FILM SCHOOL 
There's no better way to learn about filmmaking than by hearing about it firsthand. We'd love to share how this film is being made in a more intimate setting than just a one-sided blog where it's hard to get intimate knowledge of the process. You can gain access to special Google Video Hang Outs that we're going to do at the end of each major phase of the film being made: Pre-production, Shooting, and Post Production. You'll be able to ask questions and talk directly to Nick, Jon, Doug, and if he's not too busy pushing clay, Steve too. If you ever wanted to learn what a grip is or what a producer actually does or how certain special effects are made, join us and find out.  Check out the rewards on the right for a breakdown of what's available.
MONDO POSTER ARTIST -  FRANK STOCKTON POSTER
MONDO Poster by Frank Stockton
Frank Stockton is one of our favorite artists and he has agreed to do a special limited edition 24"x36" Poster Printed by D&L Screen printing of Doug Jones as the Demon. Check out Frank's other fantastic work at www.frankstockton.com
SIGNED DOUG JONES BLURAYs
Seriously upgrade your fantasy film library by getting all three of these Blu-Rays signed by Doug Jones.

campaign.story:
In 2006 I finished a full length movie called Scourge Runner. It is a low budget action sci-fi thriller where a Fugitive exiles him self on a remote planet and coming from off world, he discovers that he is smarter and faster than any of the native inhabitants. It starts to go to his head. Loneliness is as common as off road vehicle chases, gun fights and stealing food or equipment so when an Alien Sherif comes after him he actually gains a friend. Not only a friend but an chance to gain amnesty in the Galaxias and return to his previous life. The only problem with this odd feel good story is a woman! A woman with a gun! Justice is served in the end but it needs to be told with a stronger ending.
Unfortunately Scourge Runner was over shadowed by other productions but to date has been my only full length movie. So after talking with some people about distribution I decided to bring it once again on one of the front burner.
Reviewing the movie after all these years I decided that it could use a little face lift and needed a stronger ending. The ending it has now is ok and tells the story but just needs a louder voice so the story is told more clear and satisfying. Everyone knows how important the ending is and I'd like your help to make it that way.
To make this new ending I wrote up a few more scenes to add on, and they will be edited into the existing ending to make the movie end the way it should and to keep the awesomeness to the end!
To make this awesome new ending I saved up some and will use the pledge money to make costumes, props, sets, organize details, put together a crew to shoot at the two locations and make some upgrades with my editing equipment. I'm also going to tighten up the existing movie in some spots to make whole thing just that much more awesome!
Your pledge will make the difference and production starts the day after the pledges are in.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When it comes to video production I'm pretty organized so potential risks and challenges may only be needing more time for finding the potential crew, actors, making props/ sets, editing up the ending and the new tweaks to the movie Scourge Runner. The plan is the distribution company I'm dealing with (can't say who because a contract isn't signed yet) will provide the copies of the movie I'm going to get to everyone. If for some reason they decide not to work with me, everyone will still get copies of the movie from me just minus the flashy cover. There's also the slim chance that an asteroid will hit Huntington Beach and kill me causing everything to not happen but I'm pretty sure God wont let that happen, he's cool.

campaign.story:
Who We Are:
The Art Haus SLC was started by three Latina women who are very passionate about bringing contemporary arts experiences to the community in Salt Lake City.  Each of us has a strong connection to this city and to its people.  We specifically chose Salt Lake City because we knew members of this community would be excited by opportunities to participate in progressive arts experiences.  We are delighted to share our talents, vision and passion for arts education with you.
What We’re About:
The Art Haus SLC is dedicated to connecting members of the Salt Lake community with contemporary arts in multiple disciplines by creating opportunities for them to engage in and discover new artistic endeavors through exhibitions, performances and other digital programming.  Our goal is to create an environment that promotes supportive dialogue about the arts and their meaning.  We hope to share the process and products of artistic creation through our programs and through the use of new technologies to enhance arts education.
Why We Are Awesome!:
Salt Lake City is a cultural hub and has a burgeoning contemporary arts scene.  A number of arts organizations bring to the city art exhibitions, dance, theater, and opportunities for artists, young and old.  However, The Art Haus SLC is different in that we are a multidisciplinary arts organization that will bring in global arts experiences to the community through traditional programming (exhibitions, performances, workshops, etc.) and through new media technologies that will enhance the arts education experience.  We want to bring the world to Salt Lake and have the world see us as makers of art.  But to do this we will need your help!!
What We Are Asking for:
The Art Haus SLC is asking for $5,000 to support programming during our 2012 year.
Your money will fund:
Guest Lecturer
Space rental for our guest lecturer ($50)
Stipend for guest lecturer ($100)
Event prep and costs for marketing and outreach  ($150)
Webcast/video production ($50)
Dance-A-Thon Event
Space rental for our Dance-A-Thon ($300)
Event prep and costs for marketing and outreach ($500)
Water/Juice for performance groups and guests ($150)
Sound mechanic ($250)
Stipend for guest performers, approx. 12 individual/groups ($1200)
TIMEless exhibition
Gallery rental ($300)
Travel and art transportation costs ($500)
Gallery lighting ($200)
Installation ($350)
Catalogue printing ($150)
Event prep and printing for marketing and outreach ($500)
Staff stipends for 3 staff members ($350)
The Art Haus SLC will also accept in-kind donations for digital technology (e.g. digital cameras, video recorders, digital projectors, etc.).  Although we recognize this type of donation does not contribute to our Kickstarter fund, we welcome these types of contributions that support  and strengthen our work.  Please contact us directly if you choose to make this type of donation rather than a monetary one.

campaign.story:
My name is Rocket Cordray, and I have written & illustrated a 200 page book concerning the womb and its association with the bridal veil. I have included anecdotes of my life story and my experience of Mormonism, and I seek to ennoble my religious culture (and especially Mormon women) by delicately discussing an association that is dominantly left unclear by the scriptures, rites, culture and protocol of our religion.
I have incorporated at least 40 of my pen and ink illustrations, most of which involve a style that is born from my admiration of expressionism, futurism, cubism, graffiti, comics, Czech animation and religious iconography. Because of these associations, this book promises to be a unique artifact in my religious culture, which is dominated by nonfiction books that are concerned with ancient studies, apologetics, and religious scholarship.
Because I am an artist, this book is more concerned with illuminated lettering, elaborate borders, and visual symbols than it is with scholarship. But I was an English major, so there will be plenty of literary turns, prose, critical theory, and examinations of popular culture to chew on as well.
To properly fund a book that I can't afford to publish, I am offering as incentives for pledging all of the original artwork that I can find... which, again, comes out to about 40 pen & ink drawings. Each of these will be signed and framed. I am also printing lovely posters of two of the most pertinent images in the book (the cover and the title page), and giving you the option of procuring either a soft or hard cover version of the book itself.
All of the money raised will go towards the publishing of the book. I have set a low goal because I will publish whatever amount of books that I can with whatever total I reach. So the more I raise, the more I can publish. I have also made it easy for you to give any amount you can, as even a single dollar will garner you an acknowledgment in the book (but please consider going beyond that if you can :).
Thank-you so much for checking my project out!

campaign.story:
INTRODUCTION
When I was studying animation in film school we would watch these incredibly made short films by filmmakers like Jan Svankmajer, The Quay Brothers, Henry Selick, and many others. Here's one of my favorite films by Jan Svankmajer: http://www.youtube.com/watch...
STORY (5 min short film.)
The film is about the relationship between a man and woman, where the man brings into their lives different vices and addictions symbolized in the film by mud, cigarette packages, adult magazines and other filth from the outside world. These items will come to life, crushing the woman's soul. 
We firmly believe that drug abuse, alcohol, and pornography addiction can break down individuals and tear families apart. We hope this film will serve as a cautionary tale, shedding light on the effects of abuse and encourage those in bad relationships to seek help before it is too late.
It sounds dark but it will be told in an unconventional, and beautiful way.
TECHNIQUE
This film will be shot using a combination of stop-motion animation and live action actors. The actors will be animated frame by frame to make the props of mud, rocks, bottles, cans, etc... move across their bodies.
My last animated short film "MuM" premiered at the Sundance Film Festival and went on to win many awards around the world. Here it is below: http://www.nxtdream.com/project/mum
Here are two examples of recent commercials I shot using Live action and Animation together: http://www.nxtdream.com/commercials/rogue-tattoo/ http://www.nxtdream.com/commercials/cvs-pharmacy/
HOW THE MONEY WILL BE USED
I shot a live-action commercial for a friend of mine a little while ago and we did it all for the price of a lunch. We shot in a place we got for free and in 3-4 hours we were outta there. Post was editorial on my mac, and the sound was music with no foley. So pretty easy to do and it turned out AWESOME. Here's a link: http://www.nxtdream.com/commercials/joel-ward-magician/
Animation of this nature, on the other hand can be quite expensive to do it right. You need to rent a place and be there for at least 14-16 days of shooting (not including prep). Gear you can usually borrow from a friend for a day, but for two+ weeks of shooting, you need to pay them something. Same thing with actors and crew. People can work for free for a day or a weekend, but for this type of animation you need to be able to pay people for the 2 week+ time commitment. (Even though our crew will be very very small.)
Also we need cash to buy the supplies and props. Bottles, cans, magazines, trash, etc... sounds like free stuff, but we'll have to purchase most of it, and build a small set on stage. Also we'll need gallons of white makeup for the actors to wear everyday... Basically all of the stuff you can get for free for a live-action deal we'll have to pay for.
For post there's a lot of work.... in live action you can get a lot of the sound from production and sweeten it with foley. There is no sound while shooting animation, you have to literally re-create EVERYTHIING and mix it in. It's a lot of work, but that's part of the fun of filmmaking.
My hope is that kickstarter will allow filmmakers to be able to make great films by testing out new ideas, camera techniques and tell truly original stories. Not as a full time career as a short filmmaker but as something to do in-between paid commercial projects to push new ideas and develop great films that everyone can enjoy.
